articles.description: A near-total lunar eclipse will occur on November 19, with prime visibility in North America. It will last 3 hours and 28 minutes - the longest partial lunar
articles.content:
The longest lunar eclipse of this century comes in two weeks.
During the early hours of November 19, Earth will pass between the sun and moon, casting a shadow over the latter. The eclipse will peak… [+2217 chars]
